original_title: Could Hitler Have Been Stopped? The Politics of Appeasement
overview: Explores how and whether Hitler could have been stopped, and the nature of the policy of appeasement prior to and in the early stages of WWII. Examines the extent to which a European war became a global conflict, and how Britain's global position changed irrevocably.
title: Could Hitler Have Been Stopped? The Politics of Appeasement
